articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Thursday it had struck hundreds of Hezbollah rocket launchers that had been targeted at Israel.
articles.title: UN peacekeepers in Lebanon urge de-escalation after heavy airstrikes

articles.author: Krisztina Than
articles.description: She speaks seven languages, has a PhD in particle physics, an apartment in Budapest plastered with her own pastel drawings of nudes, and a career that took her around Africa and Europe doing humanitarian work.
articles.title: On the trail of the mystery woman whose company licensed exploding pagers

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Western governments and Russia's exiled opposition should begin laying the groundwork for Russia's democratic transition after President Vladimir Putin eventually leaves office, Vladimir Kara-Murza, a Russian opposition politician, said on Friday.
articles.title: Freed Russian dissident Kara-Murza: Putin must not be allowed to win in Ukraine

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: Reform UK leader and Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage took aim at Britain's governing Labour Party on Friday, telling supporters his right-wing party was gaining voters disaffected with the government and would win the next election.
articles.title: Reform leader Nigel Farage says his party will win next UK election

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: Senior U.S. officials met with Sikh advocates on Thursday to discuss threats facing Sikhs in the United States, including a foiled murder plot against a prominent activist last year, several attendees told Reuters.
articles.title: US officials meet Sikh activists ahead of Biden-Modi meeting

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Matt Spetalnick, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. officials have not given up hope of landing a Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal but are increasingly pessimistic that a breakthrough can come anytime soon, according to sources and officials familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Prospects for a Gaza ceasefire dim even as US keeps hope

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A U.S. Secret Service probe found communication gaps and a lack of diligence ahead of the July attempted assassination of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trumpat a Butler, Pennsylvania rally.
articles.title: US Secret Service probe finds lack of diligence ahead of Trump rally shooting

articles.author: Corina Pons
articles.description: Edmundo Gonzalez told Reuters he could have been jailed and possibly tortured had he stayed in Venezuela.
articles.title: Exclusive: Venezuela's exiled opposition head was warned: 'they're coming for you'

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: Pro-European President Maia Sandu staged a city centre rally on Friday to kick off her bid for re-election in a month-long campaign held alongside a referendum to cement her drive to join the European Union.
articles.title: Sandu launches Moldova re-election bid, referendum campaign on joining EU

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A top United Nations official on Friday urged all countries with influence over Israel and Lebanese militant group Hezbollah "to leverage it now" to avoid an escalation of Middle East violence that she warned could dwarf the devastation seen so far.
articles.title: UN urges states to use sway now over Israel, Hezbollah to avoid war
